bibl.title: Letter from the Surgeon General to Lord Julian Pauncefote, May 14, 1901

div1.p: The Surgeon General forwards to Lord Julian Pauncefote twenty copies of the Report on the Etiology of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from the Surgeon General to Lord Julian Pauncefote, May 14, 1901
div1.p:
Agreeably to your request (by messenger) I have the honor
to transmit herewith twenty (20) copies of Report on The Etiology
of Yellow Fever.
div1.closer:
I have the honor to be,
Very respectfully,
Your obedient servant. Surgeon General, U. S. Army. The Right Honorable
Lord Pauncefoote,
Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary,
Office, British Embassy,
1300 Connecticut Ave., Washington, D. C.
